reviews.text: A good place to have an afternoon coffee and roam around after school.  My favorite is the food truck selling pommes frites.

The Old Town Hall on Bonn's marketplace was built 1737-1780 in the style of the Rococo by the electoral court architect Michael Leveilly. The three-storey building has a mansard roof with dormers. It is listed as an architectural monument. In the Square about a day in a week there's a Market...
Good place to have some coffee or buy cheap grocery
Very nice building

Absolutely gorgeous town hall located on the market off Bonn. On the market you can buy some great food and when it is sunny have a nice cool drink on the terraces. It is easily reachable on foot and bus, tram and metro stops aren't far away.

Wouldn’t recommend. Church structure is rebuilt with concrete and now a museum, nor longer a church. It cost 5 € entrance fee and nothing in there worth seeing. Outside is nice and couple cafes in the areas look nice. 
Bottom line, take a picture of the exterior and don’t wast your time going in.
Nice place in Berlin. Small cu te quarter that gives you completely different view of Berlin
Great historical monument. This church is worth visiting.

church and the area, specially Eiergasse has a long story which could not be understood just by seeing.
I recommend reading more about it or take a tour which has this area included.
Beautiful place full of history  with friendly insightful staff. I greatly recommend visiting it.
Beautiful modern architecture

Visited Leipzig 3-5.11.17. 
The staff, congregants, and Father Philip made this tourist feel most welcome!
Participated in Friday evening (18:00) mass. I was so happy to be able to receive Holy Eucharist on the first Friday of the month. I was worried it would not be possible, but the location of the church, a ten minute walk from my hotel, was a true blessing. Lovely experience. 
Then on Sunday, I was able to return for the 09:30 Family mass. The energy was super. And the Holy Spirit was present. 
I was also able to receive confession from Fr. Philip. An unexpected request from me,  graciously accepted from him, made me most grateful.
I am very thankful and recommend the church to all Catholics visiting. To non-Catholics I also can recommend the opportunity to see the inside and sit in peace.
Interesting church. Very strange position. Catholic Church in front of Protestant town hall! Lol
Beautiful modern architecture, open from 9-4, but usually desolated.  Wednesday morning service is cozy but with a good amount of people.
Modern but very well architecture!!!
Nice special exhibition covering the journey to the peaceful revolution in Eastern Germany. Permanent exhibition covers all kinds of school history material.
Amazing piece of history. Worth seeing especially if you understand German. Audio tour a bit pricy for what it is but the museum is free...
It is useful in terms of knowledge and history, but is in need of an update in the way of communicating and a renewed in the establishments.

I found this musuem very enlightening. It's free, so no need to purchase any tickets but it is all in german... therefore i do recommend getting the audio guide (for 5€) it's very informative.
What's intresting about this musuem is that it talks about a period of time that is not that very far away (around 1989) which means people mentioned in there could be still alive. 
It's not that big and not that fancy either but rich with information.
I recommend it if you are intressted in history and espionage.
Best museum of the city!
Really interesting museum, expecially for the ethnology section. The description were often given  just in German
Amazing museum.  Fantastic in all what you see. Come here and learn about the world.

established in 1895 and moved to its current home in 1929. The building is in fact three museums in one, housing the city's ethnography, applied and decorative arts, and musical instrument collections. The Museum of Musical Instruments is a particular favourite for visitors and includes instruments from the Middle Ages to the 20th century, as well as hands-on sound laboratories and extensive archives. Located only a 10 minute walk from the city centre.
We to the music instrument museum, they had a great array of instruments from centuries past to present day. It was need to see their evolution!

This is a fantastic place. You definitely need a full day (maybe more) to do the whole  museum.  We did this part in an afternoon which wasn't long enough for a proper visit
This is on the list of places we need to re-visit.
Great p lace enjoyed or stay.
One of the greatest locations of WGT!
Great historical site, with a wonderful museum of miniature tin figures.  Amazing handwork!!
WGT war toll.
The area looks like taken from a fairy tale. Once a year around pentacost a Viking festival is taken place in here.
Waren mit der altenpflege Klasse dort. War super. Der nette Mann Hat die Führung gut gemacht
Preiswert, aber eingeschränkte und einseitige Darstellung der Psychiatriegeschichte in der Region. Für mich nicht wirklich interessant.

Kleines gemütliches Museum. Vermehrt zum Lesen als zum ansehen, aber dennoch sehr interessant. Sind insgesamt drei Räume mit wissenswerten Überlieferungen. Im dritten Raum kann man sich zudem ein Video ansehen. Allerdings ist die Qualität sehr schlecht. Und wenn andere Besucher umher laufen, kann man durch das Knarren des Bodens kaum etwas hören. Daher einen Punkt Abzug. Ansonsten ist es. Lohnenswert sich mit diesem Thema mal auseinander zu setzen
Von außen eher unscheinbar, aber sehr nett ausgestattet. Ist einen Besuch wert.

Hier wird auf einer kleinen Ausstellungsfläche sächsische Psychatriegeschichte - spannend: auch der DDR - aus der Sicht von Betroffenen erzählt. Der Verein Durchblick e.V. bietet hier zudem eine niederschwellige erste Anlaufstelle für psychisch Betroffene.
Nice special exhibition covering the journey to the peaceful revolution in Eastern Germany. Permanent exhibition covers all kinds of school history material.
Man kann den Schülern den Unterricht zu DDR-Zeiten nahe bringen. Ein Vergleichen ist es wert. War gut gemacht von Sally.
Lehrreich,über die politischen altivitäten der einzelnen Personen und kleinen Gruppen und dem teilweise Menschen verachtenden handeln der Stasi .
Man muss das Museum suchen. Aber es ist sehr schön, dort mit den eigenen Kindern durch zu laufen. Man streift so ein wenig durch die eigene Kindheit. Eine schöne Zeitreise.
Viel Erinnerungen gehabt und viel kritisch hinterfragt, dank des Museums. Toll und das noch kostenlos, echt top!
Very good institution for contemporary art in Leipzig.
Great little Modern Contemporary Museum with some impeccable art shows and student exhibitions.
Excellent place to visit - super friendly staff and beautiful area.
Disappointing. Very little of interest on show at this small gallery.
Great place
Nice historical place
Good
Als Leipziger Urgestein konnte ich dort noch Vieles über meine Stadt erfahren . Ist auf jeden Fall einen Besuch wert.
Immer ein Traum

Wir hatten den besuch vom Schillerhaus nicht geplant und waren positiv überrascht. Wir trafen einen sehr netten Museumsmitarbeiter der uns sogar eine kleine Führung gab. Originalgetreu restauriert. Der Eintritt kostet 3 Euro.
My favorite cinema in Leipzig. Their program is always well curated and there is always something to watch for everybody. And I love that they are offering OMU of most movies.

Nice cinema with a non-mainstream (arthouse) choice of movies. 
They also have movie festivals on a regular basis (like Italian movie festival or LGBT movie festival).
Very central and cosy, hidden in a leipziger passage. 
Worth a visit!
This place was great! You can even bring food with you and don't have to pay for other things in there
Friendly Enish speaking and very helpful staff, pop corn was ok... (Sunday aftrenoon)

Two stars for the 25 minutes of advertisements before the movie. We specifically asked how long are the commercials, to plan our night accordingly, and they said around 10 minutes. 
Otherwise, good location, a good selection of movies. The cafe is a bit overpriced, the ticket prices are fair.
Naja ein Kleingarten Verein halt, mit Regeln die Richtung sinnlos gehen
The outside gardens are free and laid out nicely. They also have several stations with QR codes to scan which provide some very interesting information. Definitely worth a visit!

Lovely outdoor gardens, a great place to take photos, read on a bench, go for a stroll, or relax in nature. Everything outside is labeled so you can learn while you walk! Indoors they have more tropical plants and cacti if you're looking for more exotic plants.
The Botanical  garden Leipzig is always refreshing when looking at the different plants
Very nice exhibition outside considering is free, no idea how it is inside because you have to pay haha
The most beautiful place I have visited in my life

Why make it simple? As a visiting researcher to next building Institute for Biodiversity I was very surprised to not be able to enter the lecture room without registration and payment (if I understood correctly as my German is not so good). Anyway, what's the point to restrict entry to people interested in books? I wonder what the 3 euros city-tax per night is for... maybe so we have access to shopping center? Please take example on US Philadelphia Library & Congress libraries, Adelaide and Melbourne libraries in Australia where libraries are a public space!
Cannot say much more than the building outside, by the fact I came late for a visit.

Beautiful library building. Located close to the university and to the botanic garden. There is a cafeteria underground with a lot of options even to have lunch. Prices are ok. If you wanna drink a Coca-cola, there is a machine outside the cafeteria. They don't sell them in the cafeteria :)
Don’t even think about coming here if you aren’t fluent in german, and are able to deal with hostile staff :)

An extremely well presented museum about the development of writing and print through to digital times. Some superb artifacts in a thought provoking and informative exhibition. The building itself is interesting too. Allow a good two to three hours. The adjacent national library building houses a cafeteria serving a good selection of snacks and meals.
Great place for lunch and dinning. Historic restuarant and professional staff.
Tolles Essen - Punkt Abzug durch den Kellner. Hatte Bratkartoffeln ohne Speck bestellt & trotzdem war Speck drin!!! Anschließend wieder auf das Essen warten. Preis-Leistung in Ordnung.
Eiswelten am Bayrischen Bahnhof sind sehr sehenswert. Für groß und klein ist für jeden was dabei. Gastronomie könnte besser sein.
Wie alle unterirdischen Bahnhöfe von Leipzig: Beeindruckend, überdimensioniert, cool. Für einen Bahnhof super.
Leider ist das Essen qualitativ nicht mehr so gut, super freundliches Personal
Amazing 3D panoramic effect with "just" a big photo. The Titanic panorama with exhibit about the steel revolution is incredibly interesting. Would like to see more.

You pay 12 euros to only see a big photo of the sunk ship. There is nothing else to see here... Skip this place and spend your 12 euros more wisely. if the ticket was 6 euros then the visit could make sense.
I would not spend that money for entrance to know what is inside:( it is nice industrial building and good idea how to use it but I was expecting much more:( We were visiting Titanic
Very good setup for Titanic. Finishing end of December. Glad I got to see it, being from the Belfast area.

After reading the other reviews about the exhibition I really wanted to like it, and I did, but only for 90 minutes. This is because it was 70 minutes to do "everything", read all of the text, watch all of the video clips, do the riddle-quiz with my kids and be in the main hall for quite a while. For the entrance fee I think there needs to be more content, such as more stories from the people involved in the design and construction of the ship(s) and other great feats of the time.
It was nice. Good food and great service, which is rare in the East of Germany; hell in Germany period. The staff was very friendly and even helped us pick what we were looking for.

Always great here. I feel at home which is not often for me. The staff is always friendly and I find the food great for my taste. The atmosphere is amazingly comfortable and compares to some of the better locations I have visited around the world. If you come defiantly call ahead and reserve a bed where you can lay and enjoy the night. Great place for a romantic date for eating then laying around and enjoying drinks and the company of that special someone.
Slow service but chilled out hipster place. Expensive drinks though
Great ambience.. good quality of staff..
Genial chillig, top Cocktails, relax and enjoy. Little Lipsia Caribbean.
Perfectly cooked Saxon specialties in a relaxed atmosphere.
Quality and traditional menus. A good choice
Nice location (outside) but service was sometimes confused..

Ein schönes Restaurant in einem ehrwürdigen Gebäude.

Die Preise sind eher auf höherem Niveau. Das wäre auch kein Problem, wenn dann auch alles stimmen würde. Leider haben wir auf unser Essen sehr lange warten müssen, auf den Espresso nachher auch. Und das, obwohl es nicht wirklich voll war.

Jedoch war der Service sehr freundlich, wodurch ich dann doch noch auf vier Sterne gehen konnte. Drei wären eigentlich wohl korrekter.

Eigentlich schön gelegen. Die Passagen machen Leipzig besonders. Aber das Essen war eine Enttäuschung. Entsprach nicht den Versprechungen der Karte. Alles in allem doch nicht zu empfehlen. Gibt wesentlich bessere Adressen in Leipzig. Das  Preis- Leistungsverhältnis stimmt einfach nicht. Schade
Great Korean restaurant with friendly service. The food was also excellent.
Excellent food and unique "like home" ambience. Best Korean in Leipzig.
Fresh prepared and good food, nice staff! Tasty!
Tiny place, good food, friendly staff
Nice food and cosy atmosphere
Nice old style restaurant
Nice bar in a pretty street. My husband was on the lookout for a famous Gose beer and wasn't disappointed. We sat outside so can't comment on the interior.
Extra beer. Cosy space. Modified tradional menu.
Good  place with delicious  traditional dishes and nice service.
Cold food, wrong orders, incredibly rude waitress (the older one). I even gave it a second chance the following day and service was equally bad.

This place was absolutely AMAZING. We happened upon it looking for some pizza after leaving the museum science and industry. It is like 6 or 7 blocks from museum and it is well worth the walk or drive. The pizza is some of the best I've ever had and I grew up in the city. Small place and service was spectacular. I would give 100 stars if I could.

I stop by the bakery most mornings. The coffee is excellent and the muffins are wonderful. The great service really makes my morning.
The actual restaurant is a Hyde Park staple. It's a great place to go with visiting friends or family as it really captures the spirit of the neighborhood. I highly recommend the pizza

Their dine-in food is good, but their bakery is AMAZING. Still remains some of the best cinnamon rolls and almond croissants I've had in my life. Their pumpkin milkshake in the fall is also amazing. Sandwiches are tasty. Really can't go wrong with any of the bakery goods. Extremely limited seating though, which is a bummer.
Great specialty drinks! The mocha is amazing and the ice mocha (with ice cream) was very good. The cafe is small with very limited seating, but is a great place to grab a drink to go.
Always a fine time here. The food is very tasty. I had Turkey chili.  It came quickly and was delicious.  Staff is friendly and efficient.
